Literature.Title: Dual-Mechanism Peptide SR25 has Broad Antimicrobial Activity and Potential Application for Healing Bacteria-infected Diabetic Wounds
Literature.Author: Luo XY, Hu CM, Yin Q, Zhang XM, Liu ZZ, Zhou CK, Zhang JG, Chen W, Yang YJ

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Salmonella typhimurium SL1344(MIC=>100µM),Klebsiella pneumoniae K7(MIC=>100µM),Escherichia coli O157:H7(MIC=>100µM),Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853(MIC=>100µM),Bacillus subtilis BL-4(MIC=>100µM),Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Pullorum ATCC 19945(MIC=25µM),Staphylococcus aureus USA 300(MIC=16µM),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25904(MIC=6.25µM),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923(MIC=6.25µM),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 29213(MIC=6.25µM),Enterococcus faecalis 4P-SA(MIC=6.25µM),Enterococcus faecalis ATCC 51299(MIC=12.5µM),Listeria monocytogenes EGD(MIC=6.25µM),Listeria monocytogenes 10403s(MIC=3.13µM),Listeria monocytogenes ATCC 19115(MIC=3.13µM),Staphylococcus epidermidis YYF-771(MIC=1.57µM),Murine macrophage cells RAW 264.7(no activity data),Mouse fibrosarcoma L929(no activity data)
